title: How should I prepare to read Kant? - Quora
tags: The Critique of Pure Reason (1781 book)

response.answer_text: My personal introduction to Kant came from reading James Jeans’ Physics and Philosophy (1943). This book is not about Kant’s philosophy, but briefly discusses his approach to metaphysics in the context of important scientific and philosophical problems. Kant is never an easy read. It is almost necessary to engage the services of a university level instructor. As an alternative you might take a look at the online Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy.
Read a fair bit of CS Lewis first, especially ‘The Abolition of Man’, and his essay ‘Subjectivism’ in the collected essays, ‘Christian Reflections’.
